scenario:
The S&P 500 has risen over 55% in the last two years, but investors are concerned about the market's volatility. To mitigate this risk, it's essential to invest in top companies that can withstand market fluctuations. Five stocks recommended by Fool.com contributors are Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Micron Technology (MU), Brookfield Renewable (BEP, BEPC), PepsiCo (PEP), and United Parcel Service (UPS).

Alphabet is expected to benefit from the rise of AI agents, with its Gemini large language model and Google Cloud's Vertex AI Agent Builder making it an attractive pick. The company's shares trade at 21.3 times forward earnings, lower than its peers.

Micron Technology is investing $50 billion in new and upgraded facilities by 2030, positioning itself as a crucial hardware provider for the US tech industry. The company's shares are trading at 3.3 times sales and 7.6 times forward earnings, making it a bargain.

Brookfield Renewable underperformed the S&P 500 in 2024 but has a solid chance to recover and rally in 2025. The company is developing nearly 200 GW of capacity, reflecting its massive growth potential, and is expected to deliver record numbers for 2024.

PepsiCo underperformed the S&P 500 in 2024 but is still a cash- and profit-generating machine. The company is expected to deliver 4% organic sales growth and 8% higher earnings per share in 2024, and its dividend yield is back above 3.5%.

UPS is at its lowest level since July 2020 and is an incredible opportunity for patient investors. The company has fallen due to declining margins and expensive negotiations with the Teamsters Union, but is expected to return to growth in 2025 with 17% earnings per share growth. UPS has a higher yield at 5.3% compared to its peer FedEx, making it a more intriguing transportation stock for passive-income investors.
